abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Integrated Urban
            Development Project for Yemen were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately unsatisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            high, Bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: identifying stakeholder incentives
            through a political economy analysis is essential to
            underpinning project design and confirming ownership,
            especially for policy reforms. Mixing infrastructure
            investments with policy reforms is challenging in a
            fragility, conflict, and violence (FCV) context but is
            feasible with strategic planning, clear champions, and
            strong implementation support. Restructuring should be
            considered as a key tool in implementation support rather
            than as a last resort. The challenging operating environment
            in FVC countries requires continuity and due diligence on
            the Bank’s implementation support system. Adapting the
            Bank’s operational approach to better fit an FCV context
            will allow for more flexibility and facilitate proactivity.

25117058.trustfund:
TF091825-GFDRRTRACK II -YEMEN: DISASTER
            RISK REDUCTION INSTITUTIONAL MAINSTREAMI,TF092824-INTEGRATED URBAN DEVELOPMENT
            PROJECT (IUDP)

repnme.cdata!:
Yemen - Integrated Urban Development
            Project (IUDP) : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Integrated Urban
            Development Project (IUDP) are to: (i) improve access to
            basic services in select informal settlements in urban areas
            in Taiz; and (ii) strengthen dialogue on national framework
            for urban upgrading. Only two issues come up unexpectedly
            during the implementation of Al Maftash urban upgrading
            project, these two cases were due to the request and
            willingness of local authorities to widening the only road
            in Al Maftash area available to provide access to the poor
            communities, which located at the lower part of project and
            adjacent to the Wadi from the other side. The remaining of
            Al Maftash area has a difficult topography and the
            construction of stone steps was provided. Based on the
            request of local authority to help and determine the impact
            of street widening on local citizens, the contractor in
            coordination with construction supervision consultant and
            PIU team carried out the required survey and identified the
            following two small issues need compensation for property
            acquisition:  shack of 6

display_title.display_title:
Yemen - Integrated Urban
            Development Project (IUDP) : environmental assessment :
            Social safeguards issues and ARAP
